turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 2008 Democratic Party presidential debates and forums.
turn.1: Why was there a language barrier between Barack Obama and Joe Biden?
turn.2: Both are fluent in Spanish but it was perceived to cause an unfair advantage for the two.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The TV audience of 2.2 million was also the debate season's youngest, at an average of 36 years old. Yahoo!, in partnership with The Huffington Post, produced a "mashup" debate with Charlie Rose interviewing the candidates.
turn.6: Segments were recorded on September 12, with the "mashups" posted on September 13.
turn.7: Did they have any other debates?
turn.8: PBS held a forum focused on domestic issues, specifically health care and financial security.
turn.9: When did that forum take place?
turn.10: It was moderated by Judy Woodruff, and was a joint venture between IPTV and AARP.
turn.12: Obama rejected PBS's invitation, and Gravel and Kucinich were excluded from the debate because they did not have at least one paid staff member or office space in Iowa.
